DataElement.preferredName: Person Prior Radiation Therapy Abdominal Cavity Pelvis Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a person has received a prior administration of radiation therapy, treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target by radiation, to the abdominal cavity, the area of the body that contains the pancreas, stomach, intestine, liver, gallbladder, and other organs, or pelvis as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Prior Radiation Therapy Abdominal Cavity Pelvis Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having a received a prior administration of radiation therapy, treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target by radiation, to the abdominal cavity, the area of the body that contains the pancreas, stomach, intestine, liver, gallbladder, and other organs, or pelvis as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Prior Radiation Therapy Abdominal Cavity Pelvis Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.:That portion of the body that lies between the thorax and the pelvis.:The structure of the vertebrate skeleton supporting the lower limbs in humans and the hind limbs or corresponding parts in other vertebrates.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
The cavity located between the lungs and pelvis. It contains the lower esophagus, stomach, pancreas, intestines, liver, gallbladder and spleen.
The bony, basin-shaped structure formed by the hipbones and the base of the backbone supporting the lower limbs in humans.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received prior radiotherapy to any portion of the abdominal cavity or pelvis other than for the treatment of cervical cancer within the last three years?
